responsibilities: Design and implement new service offerings on top of a strong cloud foundation
Support development teams in leveraging larger machine learning operations (MLOps)
Drive the design, implementation, and management for expanding observability infrastructure
Lead sustainable incident response, blameless postmortems, and production improvements
Collaborate with software development and infrastructure teams to design, implement, and maintain multiple business offerings
Automate deployment, scaling, and management of infrastructure using modern DevOps tools and practices
Monitor and optimize system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement solutions
Implement and maintain configuration management and infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform
Collaborate in designing and implementing security best practices throughout development and deployment pipelines
Define and document best practices across all pillars of DevOps/SRE
qualifications: Expertise with container-based technologies, e.g., Dockers, Kubernetes
Expertise with infrastructure as code, configuration management tools, and cloud automation, e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation
Good understanding of networking and security concepts
Experience in defining and building CI/CD processes and working with common CI/CD tools
Great programming skills in languages such as Python, Go, PowerShell
Experience in Linux Systems Administration, scripting, and troubleshooting in a production environment
Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools (Prometheus, ELK Stack, Grafana)
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed focus primarily on cloud infrastructure, DevOps, and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). The responsibilities include designing and implementing service offerings on a cloud foundation, supporting MLOps, managing observability infrastructure, incident response, and automating deployment and scaling using DevOps tools. The skills required include expertise in container-based technologies, infrastructure as code, CI/CD processes, programming skills, and Linux systems administration.

There is a mention of supporting development teams in leveraging larger machine learning operations (MLOps), which indicates some involvement with machine learning. However, there is no specific mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on infrastructure, automation, and cloud management rather than on developing or deploying GenAI or LLMs.

Therefore, based on the provided information, the job does not explicitly involve working with Generative AI or language models.
